alert.note: Alert for Lower Washington County (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 27 at 2:29PM MDT until October 30 at 10:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM SATURDAY TO NOON MDT SUNDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, northeast winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 possible, especially on Monday morning. * WHERE...Lower Washington County. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 9 PM Saturday to noon MDT Sunday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Saturday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. A few power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles and vehicles with trailers. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For Sunday morning expect elevations below 3500 feet to remain above freezing. During the day on Sunday, temperatures will rise back above freezing. By Monday morning the remaining elevations in Washington County will likely be near, or below, freezing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
